kubernetes-cluster-config.name: Kubernetes Cluster Config
kubernetes-cluster-config.description:
Stores configuration for interaction with Kubernetes clusters.

See `from_file` for creation.
kubernetes-cluster-config.code_example:
Load a saved Kubernetes cluster config:
```python
from prefect.blocks.kubernetes import KubernetesClusterConfig

cluster_config_block = KubernetesClusterConfig.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: KubernetesClusterConfig
fields.description:
Stores configuration for interaction with Kubernetes clusters.

See `from_file` for creation.

config.title: Config
config.description: The entire contents of a kubectl config file.

context_name.title: Context Name
context_name.description: The name of the kubectl context to use.

ms-teams-webhook.name: Microsoft Teams Webhook
ms-teams-webhook.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Microsoft Teams webhook.
ms-teams-webhook.code_example:
Load a saved Teams webhook and send a message:
```python
from prefect.blocks.notifications import MicrosoftTeamsWebhook
teams_webhook_block = MicrosoftTeamsWebhook.load("BLOCK_NAME")
teams_webhook_block.notify("Hello from Prefect!")
```

fields.title: MicrosoftTeamsWebhook
fields.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Microsoft Teams webhook.

notify_type.title: Notify Type
notify_type.description: The type of notification being performed; the prefect_default is a plain notification that does not attach an image.

url.title: Webhook URL
url.description: The Teams incoming webhook URL used to send notifications.

opsgenie-webhook.name: Opsgenie Webhook
opsgenie-webhook.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Opsgenie webhook.
opsgenie-webhook.code_example:
Load a saved Opsgenie webhook and send a message:
```python
from prefect.blocks.notifications import OpsgenieWebhook
opsgenie_webhook_block = OpsgenieWebhook.load("BLOCK_NAME")
opsgenie_webhook_block.notify("Hello from Prefect!")
```

fields.title: OpsgenieWebhook
fields.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Opsgenie webhook.

notify_type.title: Notify Type
notify_type.description: The type of notification being performed; the prefect_default is a plain notification that does not attach an image.

apikey.title: API Key
apikey.description: The API Key associated with your Opsgenie account.

target_user.title: Target User
target_user.description: The user(s) you wish to notify.

target_team.title: Target Team
target_team.description: The team(s) you wish to notify.

target_schedule.title: Target Schedule
target_schedule.description: The schedule(s) you wish to notify.

target_escalation.title: Target Escalation
target_escalation.description: The escalation(s) you wish to notify.

batch.title: Batch
batch.description: Notify all targets in batches (instead of individually).

tags.title: Tags
tags.description: A comma-separated list of tags you can associate with your Opsgenie message.

priority.title: Priority
priority.description: The priority to associate with the message. It is on a scale between 1 (LOW) and 5 (EMERGENCY).

alias.title: Alias
alias.description: The alias to associate with the message.

entity.title: Entity
entity.description: The entity to associate with the message.

details.title: Details
details.description: Additional details composed of key/values pairs.

pager-duty-webhook.name: Pager Duty Webhook
pager-duty-webhook.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided PagerDuty webhook.
pager-duty-webhook.code_example:
Load a saved PagerDuty webhook and send a message:
```python
from prefect.blocks.notifications import PagerDutyWebHook
pagerduty_webhook_block = PagerDutyWebHook.load("BLOCK_NAME")
pagerduty_webhook_block.notify("Hello from Prefect!")
```

fields.title: PagerDutyWebHook
fields.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided PagerDuty webhook.

integration_key.title: Integration Key
integration_key.description: This can be found on the Events API V2 integration's detail page, and is also referred to as a Routing Key. This must be provided alongside `api_key`, but will error if provided alongside `url`.

api_key.title: API Key
api_key.description: This can be found under Integrations. This must be provided alongside `integration_key`, but will error if provided alongside `url`.

source.title: Source
source.description: The source string as part of the payload.

component.title: Component
component.description: The component string as part of the payload.

group.title: Group
group.description: The group string as part of the payload.

class_id.title: Class ID
class_id.description: The class string as part of the payload.

clickable_url.title: Clickable URL
clickable_url.description: A clickable URL to associate with the notice.

include_image.title: Include Image
include_image.description: Associate the notification status via a represented icon.

custom_details.title: Custom Details
custom_details.description: Additional details to include as part of the payload.

slack-webhook.name: Slack Webhook
slack-webhook.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Slack webhook.
slack-webhook.code_example:
Load a saved Slack webhook and send a message:
```python
from prefect.blocks.notifications import SlackWebhook

slack_webhook_block = SlackWebhook.load("BLOCK_NAME")
slack_webhook_block.notify("Hello from Prefect!")
```

fields.title: SlackWebhook
fields.description: Enables sending notifications via a provided Slack webhook.

notify_type.title: Notify Type
notify_type.description: The type of notification being performed; the prefect_default is a plain notification that does not attach an image.

url.title: Webhook URL
url.description: Slack incoming webhook URL used to send notifications.

twilio-sms.name: Twilio SMS
twilio-sms.description: Enables sending notifications via Twilio SMS.
twilio-sms.code_example:
Load a saved `TwilioSMS` block and send a message:
```python
from prefect.blocks.notifications import TwilioSMS
twilio_webhook_block = TwilioSMS.load("BLOCK_NAME")
twilio_webhook_block.notify("Hello from Prefect!")
```

fields.title: TwilioSMS
fields.description: Enables sending notifications via Twilio SMS.

notify_type.title: Notify Type
notify_type.description: The type of notification being performed; the prefect_default is a plain notification that does not attach an image.

account_sid.title: Account Sid
account_sid.description: The Twilio Account SID - it can be found on the homepage of the Twilio console.

auth_token.title: Auth Token
auth_token.description: The Twilio Authentication Token - it can be found on the homepage of the Twilio console.

from_phone_number.title: From Phone Number
from_phone_number.description: The valid Twilio phone number to send the message from.

to_phone_numbers.title: To Phone Numbers
to_phone_numbers.description: A list of valid Twilio phone number(s) to send the message to.

date-time.name: Date Time
date-time.description: A block that represents a datetime
date-time.code_example:
Load a stored JSON value:
```python
from prefect.blocks.system import DateTime

data_time_block = DateTime.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: DateTime
fields.description: A block that represents a datetime

json.name: JSON
json.code_example:
Load a stored JSON value:
```python
from prefect.blocks.system import JSON

json_block = JSON.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

secret.name: Secret
secret.description:
A block that represents a secret value. The value stored in this block will be obfuscated when
this block is logged or shown in the UI.
secret.code_example:
```python
from prefect.blocks.system import Secret

secret_block = Secret.load("BLOCK_NAME")

# Access the stored secret
secret_block.get()
```

fields.title: Secret
fields.description:
A block that represents a secret value. The value stored in this block will be obfuscated when
this block is logged or shown in the UI.

value.title: Value
value.description: A string value that should be kept secret.

string.name: String
string.description: A block that represents a string
string.code_example:
Load a stored string value:
```python
from prefect.blocks.system import String

string_block = String.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: String
fields.description: A block that represents a string

docker-container.name: Docker Container
docker-container.description:
Runs a command in a container.

Requires a Docker Engine to be connectable. Docker settings will be retrieved from
the environment.

Click [here](https://docs.prefect.io/tutorials/docker/) to see a tutorial.
docker-container.code_example:
```python
from prefect.infrastructure.docker import DockerContainer

docker_container_block = DockerContainer.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: DockerContainer
fields.description:
Runs a command in a container.

Requires a Docker Engine to be connectable. Docker settings will be retrieved from
the environment.

Click [here](https://docs.prefect.io/tutorials/docker/) to see a tutorial.

env.title: Environment
env.description: Environment variables to set in the configured infrastructure.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels applied to the infrastructure for metadata purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name applied to the infrastructure for identification.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run in the infrastructure.

image.title: Image
image.description: Tag of a Docker image to use. Defaults to the Prefect image.

image_pull_policy.description: Specifies if the image should be pulled.

networks.title: Networks
networks.description: A list of strings specifying Docker networks to connect the container to.

network_mode.title: Network Mode
network_mode.description: The network mode for the created container (e.g. host, bridge). If 'networks' is set, this cannot be set.

auto_remove.title: Auto Remove
auto_remove.description: If set, the container will be removed on completion.

volumes.title: Volumes
volumes.description: A list of volume mount strings in the format of "local_path:container_path".

stream_output.title: Stream Output
stream_output.description: If set, the output will be streamed from the container to local standard output.

memswap_limit.title: Memswap Limit
memswap_limit.description: Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to disable swap. Should only be set if `mem_limit` is also set. If `mem_limit` is set, this defaults toallowing the container to use as much swap as memory. For example, if `mem_limit` is 300m and `memswap_limit` is not set, the container can use 600m in total of memory and swap.

mem_limit.title: Mem Limit
mem_limit.description: Memory limit of the created container. Accepts float values to enforce a limit in bytes or a string with a unit e.g. 100000b, 1000k, 128m, 1g. If a string is given without a unit, bytes are assumed.

privileged.title: Privileged
privileged.description: Give extended privileges to this container.

DockerRegistry.title: DockerRegistry
DockerRegistry.description:
Connects to a Docker registry.

Requires a Docker Engine to be connectable.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to log into the registry with.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to log into the registry with.

registry_url.title: Registry Url
registry_url.description: The URL to the registry. Generally, "http" or "https" can be omitted.

reauth.title: Reauth
reauth.description: Whether or not to reauthenticate on each interaction.

docker-registry.name: Docker Registry
docker-registry.description:
Connects to a Docker registry.

Requires a Docker Engine to be connectable.
docker-registry.code_example:
```python
from prefect.infrastructure.docker import DockerRegistry

docker_registry_block = DockerRegistry.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: DockerRegistry
fields.description:
Connects to a Docker registry.

Requires a Docker Engine to be connectable.

username.title: Username
username.description: The username to log into the registry with.

password.title: Password
password.description: The password to log into the registry with.

registry_url.title: Registry Url
registry_url.description: The URL to the registry. Generally, "http" or "https" can be omitted.

reauth.title: Reauth
reauth.description: Whether or not to reauthenticate on each interaction.

kubernetes-job.name: Kubernetes Job
kubernetes-job.description:
Runs a command as a Kubernetes Job.

Click [here](https://medium.com/the-prefect-blog/how-to-use-kubernetes-with-prefect-419b2e8b8cb2/) to see a tutorial.
kubernetes-job.code_example:
```python
from prefect.infrastructure.kubernetes import KubernetesJob

kubernetes_job_block = KubernetesJob.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: KubernetesJob
fields.description:
Runs a command as a Kubernetes Job.

Click [here](https://medium.com/the-prefect-blog/how-to-use-kubernetes-with-prefect-419b2e8b8cb2/) to see a tutorial.

env.title: Environment
env.description: Environment variables to set in the configured infrastructure.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels applied to the infrastructure for metadata purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name applied to the infrastructure for identification.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run in the infrastructure.

image.title: Image
image.description: The image reference of a container image to use for the job, for example, `docker.io/prefecthq/prefect:2-latest`.The behavior is as described in the Kubernetes documentation and uses the latest version of Prefect by default, unless an image is already present in a provided job manifest.

namespace.title: Namespace
namespace.description: The Kubernetes namespace to use for this job. Defaults to 'default' unless a namespace is already present in a provided job manifest.

service_account_name.title: Service Account Name
service_account_name.description: The Kubernetes service account to use for this job.

image_pull_policy.description: The Kubernetes image pull policy to use for job containers.

cluster_config.title: Cluster Config
cluster_config.description: The Kubernetes cluster config to use for this job.

job.title: Base Job Manifest
job.description: The base manifest for the Kubernetes Job.

customizations.title: Customizations
customizations.description: A list of JSON 6902 patches to apply to the base Job manifest.

job_watch_timeout_seconds.title: Job Watch Timeout Seconds
job_watch_timeout_seconds.description: Number of seconds to wait for each event emitted by the job before timing out. Defaults to `None`, which means no timeout will be enforced while waiting for each event in the job lifecycle.

pod_watch_timeout_seconds.title: Pod Watch Timeout Seconds
pod_watch_timeout_seconds.description: Number of seconds to watch for pod creation before timing out.

stream_output.title: Stream Output
stream_output.description: If set, output will be streamed from the job to local standard output.

finished_job_ttl.title: Finished Job Ttl
finished_job_ttl.description: The number of seconds to retain jobs after completion. If set, finished jobs will be cleaned up by Kubernetes after the given delay. If None (default), jobs will need to be manually removed.

KubernetesClusterConfig.title: KubernetesClusterConfig
KubernetesClusterConfig.description:
Stores configuration for interaction with Kubernetes clusters.

See `from_file` for creation.

config.title: Config
config.description: The entire contents of a kubectl config file.

context_name.title: Context Name
context_name.description: The name of the kubectl context to use.

process.name: Process
process.description:
Run a command in a new process.

Current environment variables and Prefect settings will be included in the created
process. Configured environment variables will override any current environment
variables.
process.code_example:
```python
from prefect.infrastructure.process import Process

process_block = Process.load("BLOCK_NAME")
```

fields.title: Process
fields.description:
Run a command in a new process.

Current environment variables and Prefect settings will be included in the created
process. Configured environment variables will override any current environment
variables.

env.title: Environment
env.description: Environment variables to set in the configured infrastructure.

labels.title: Labels
labels.description: Labels applied to the infrastructure for metadata purposes.

name.title: Name
name.description: Name applied to the infrastructure for identification.

command.title: Command
command.description: The command to run in the infrastructure.

stream_output.title: Stream Output
stream_output.description: If set, output will be streamed from the process to local standard output.

working_dir.title: Working Dir
working_dir.description: If set, the process will open within the specified path as the working directory. Otherwise, a temporary directory will be created.
